description: Post-test for type to chart scenario - assesses learning after tutoring session

questions.question_text: You need to show website traffic patterns across each day of the week for 3 months. Which chart family is most appropriate?
questions.explanation: Line or area charts are best for showing temporal trends and patterns over time.

questions.question_text: You want to compare quarterly sales across 4 regions. Which visualization is most effective?
questions.explanation: Column or bar charts excel at comparing values across discrete categories like regions.

questions.question_text: You have 20 product categories but one category accounts for 60% of sales. What should you consider for composition visualization?

options.text: A pie chart will work perfectly with all 20 categories
Consider grouping smaller categories or using a different chart type to handle many categories
Always use a line chart for this situation

questions.explanation: With many categories, consider grouping smaller ones or using alternative visualizations to avoid clutter while highlighting the dominant category.

questions.question_text: Which data type is MOST suitable for a line chart?

options.text: Time series data showing trends over days/months

questions.explanation: Line charts are designed for continuous or temporal data where showing trends and progression is important.
